bsw.explanation: BSW explicitly states that they want to bring necessary dentures back into the catalogue of benefits of statutory health insurance.

citations.content: BSW: Every year, citizens pay more than five billion euros out of their own pockets for dental treatments. We want to bring necessary dentures and visual aids back into the catalogue of benefits of statutory health insurance. People's smiles must not depend on their wallets!
BSW: These false incentives must be overcome. Health care is based on human contact. Medical confidentiality is therefore a basic prerequisite for creating trust in care.

linke.explanation: LINKE supports covering all medically useful services, including dentures, under solidarity-based health insurance.

citations.content: LINKE: Our solidarity-based health insurance is to cover all medically useful services such as dentures, glasses and ibuprofen on an evidence-based basis – but we can save ourselves proven useless services •  Our solidarity-based comprehensive care insurance is intended to cover all care services: People with care needs and their families often pay more than 3,000 euros a month for a place in a nursing home – this would then be omitted: No care service may be refused for cost reasons!

LINKE: We are committed to solidarity-based health and long-term care insurance Everyone pays, contributions are levied on all incomes, everyone is well cared for The contribution assessment ceiling is abolished Contributions must also be paid for income from capital gains and other types of income Privately insured persons are transferred to statutory health insurance As a result, the contribution for health insurance will fall from the current 17. For all people with a monthly income of less than 7,100 euros (gross), contributions will decrease.

gruene.explanation: GRUENE supports a citizens' insurance that includes all insured persons, suggesting a broader coverage, but does not explicitly mention dental treatments.

citations.content: GRUENE: We are committed to financing the health and care of our society that is more reliable and equitable than the status quo. The basis for this is a fair participation of all insured persons in the financing. Our goal is citizens' insurance, which includes not only those with statutory health insurance but also the privately insured in the solidarity-based financial equalization of the health care system 93 .

spd.explanation: SPD supports equal access to high-quality care and a solidarity-based system, suggesting broader coverage, but does not explicitly mention dental treatments.

citations.content: SPD: We want a health system in our country in which everyone has equal access to the same quality and which does not overwhelm anyone financially. The health of everyone is an indicator of how a country makes policy. Our goal is a fair health care system that ensures fast and high-quality care regardless of crises without overburdening people financially.

SPD: We reject any deterioration in services for patients. We rely on a solidarity-based system of citizens' insurance that gives all people equal access to health services of the same quality. For federal civil servants, we are creating a real right to choose statutory health insurance through a lump-sum subsidy.

volt.explanation: VOLT supports a solidarity-based health system that ensures better care, suggesting broader coverage, but does not explicitly mention dental treatments.

citations.content: VOLT: HEALTH INSURANCE REFORM – NEW, SOLIDARITY-BASED AND EFFICIENT A solidarity-based health system that is fairer and more efficient ensures better care and lower administrative costs. We all benefit from fair financing, greater co-determination and sustainable health services. That's why Volt is committed to this future: •  Common European health insurance: a common health insurance scheme is created for all, including civil servants and the self-employed -  initially at national level, and in the long term at European level.

VOLT: Evidence-based services: Non-evidence-based services such as homeopathy are excluded from statutory health insurance financing. Needs-based care: Oversupply through commercial incentives or undersupply due to shortage of appointments is combated.

afd.explanation: AFD does not mention any specific support for covering all dental treatments under statutory health insurance.

citations.content: AFD: We want every citizen to be able to decide for themselves who they want to be treated by and reject the abolition of the alternative practitioner profession.

AFD: from the federal budget in the future. Another starting point for reducing health insurance contributions is the exorbitantly high administrative costs, which we want to massively reduce by merging he...

cdu.explanation: No information is provided about CDU's position on covering all dental treatments under statutory health insurance.

fdp.explanation: FDP does not mention any specific support for covering all dental treatments under statutory health insurance.

citations.content: FDP: We are committed to the dual system of statutory (GKV) and private (PKV) health insurance. Therefore, we reject a single health insurance fund (so-called citizens' insurance). In both insurance systems, we want to strengthen the freedom of change and freedom of choice for the insured.
